TextView.android:text: Sheet J: Immediate Activities as a Minor Roadway Works during periods of Low Risk
This sheet covers operations(in a time of less
than typically 5-30 seconds but not greater
than 60 seconds) where immediate
reinstatement is possible and in periods of
low risk. Works in this category can be
carried out once the following criteria are
met and provided safe working methods
are used.
Are there at least 2 operatives on site?
Are all operatives wearing Class III high
visibility clothing?
Is there clear visibility in all directions?
Including weather, and obstructions to view?
Is the vehicle parked appropriately and not
obstructing the visibility?
Is the traffic count less than 20 vehicles/3 mins?
Are there any moving vehicles within 100m
of the site?
Is Immediate Reinstatement of the site possible?
See description above.
Use Sheet 0 to select appropriate
traffic management plan, or refer
to your inspector.
Complete the works in a safe manner:
1. One operative designated as Man-On-Watch
to look out for traffic for duration of job.
2. Wait until road is Clear, move into position.
3. Man-On-Watch keeps lookout for traffic for
duration of the job.
4. When Man-On-Watch signals, operatives
leave the work site immediately and return
to path.
5. Wait until road is clear again, and repeat until
task is complete.
